sentence.Network_en: The groups at the conference spoke piously of their fondness for democracy.
sentence.Network_cn: 与会团体不切实际地谈起了对民主的热爱。

sentence.Network_en: Conti kneeled and crossed himself piously.
sentence.Network_cn: 康蒂跪下来虔诚地用手在胸前画了个十字。

sentence.Network_en: Many pilgrims knelt piously at the shrine.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多朝圣者心虔意诚地在神殿跪拜.

PerfectNetExp.abs: Carter ever had accepted Christian severe test piously when south ., 卡特在南方时曾虔诚地接受过基督教的洗礼.

piously asked Lokesvararaja for his opinion . " This vow of mine surpasses the vows of other Buddhas , " he said . " I just don't know if it can be achieved .他很诚敬地询问世自在王佛的意见，「我这个心愿，胜过其他佛所发的誓愿，只是不知道能不能实现？」

RelatedPhrase.word: Pay respects to Concentration Camp piously

list.key: Pay respects to Concentration Camp piously
list.abs: Pay respects to Concentration Camp piously ., 虔诚瞻仰集中营.

entry.def: Someone who is pious is very religious and moral.

example.ex: He was brought up by pious female relatives.
example.tran: 他是由虔诚的女性亲属带大的。

entry.def: If you describe someone's words as pious, you think that their words are full of good intentions but do not lead to anything useful being done.

example.ex: What we need is not manifestos of pious intentions, but real action.
example.tran: 我们需要的不是善意但难以实现的宣言，而是实际行动。

entry.def: If you describe someone as pious, you disapprove of the fact that they pretend to be very religious without being sincere.

example.ex: His attitude is compassionate without being pious.
example.tran: 他的态度是真心实意的同情。

means.word_mean: 2. in a devout and pious manner;

auth_sentence.content: Ladies of the parish had...offered...piously to watch with her.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ladies of the parish had...offered...piously to watch with her.

auth_sentence.content: They piously believed that desire sets one free, and many still do.
auth_sentence.res_content: They piously believed that desire sets one free, and many still do.
